x_f = [state_f.index,Response_f.index,Coverage_f.index,Education_f.index,EmploymentStatus_f.index,LocationCode_f.index,MaritalStatus_f.index,NumberComplaints_f.index,NumberPolicies_f.index,PolicyType_f.index,Policy_f.index,RenewOfferType_f.index,SalesChannel_f.index,VehicleClass_f.index,VehicleSize_f.index]
x_m = [state_m.index,Response_m.index,Coverage_m.index,Education_m.index,EmploymentStatus_m.index,LocationCode_m.index,MaritalStatus_m.index,NumberComplaints_m.index,NumberPolicies_m.index,PolicyType_m.index,Policy_m.index,RenewOfferType_m.index,SalesChannel_m.index,VehicleClass_m.index,VehicleSize_m.index]

y_f = [state_f.values,Response_f.values,Coverage_f.values,Education_f.values,EmploymentStatus_f.values,LocationCode_f.values,MaritalStatus_f.values,NumberComplaints_f.values,NumberPolicies_f.values,PolicyType_f.values,Policy_f.values,RenewOfferType_f.values,SalesChannel_f.values,VehicleClass_f.values,VehicleSize_f.values]
y_m = [state_m.values,Response_m.values,Coverage_m.values,Education_m.values,EmploymentStatus_m.values,LocationCode_m.values,MaritalStatus_m.values,NumberComplaints_m.values,NumberPolicies_m.values,PolicyType_m.values,Policy_m.values,RenewOfferType_m.values,SalesChannel_m.values,VehicleClass_m.values,VehicleSize_m.values]

title =['count of Female vs Male in each country','Count of Male Response vs Female Response','Count of Male Coverage vs Female Coverage','Count Education level of Male vs Female','Count of Employment Status of Male vs Female','Location Code of Male vs Female','Count Marital Status Male vs Female','Count Number Complaints Male vs Female','Count Number Policies Male vs Female','Count Policy Type  Male vs Female','Count Number Policy Male vs Female','Count Renew Offer Type Male vs Female','Count Sales Channel  Male vs Female','Count Vehicle Class Male vs Female','Count Vehicle Size Male vs Female']

for i in range(len(x_f)):
    fig = go.Figure()
    fig.add_trace(go.Bar(
        x =  x_f[i] ,
        y =  y_f[i] ,
        name = 'Female',
        marker_color='rgb(158,202,225)'
    ))

    fig.add_trace(go.Bar(
        x =  x_m[i] ,
        y =  y_m[i] ,
        name = 'Male',
        marker_color='lightslategray'
    ))

    fig.update_layout(barmode='group', title=title[i])
    fig.show()

Open_Complaints_date = df.groupby('Effective To Date').sum().sort_values('Number of Open Complaints',ascending=False)['Number of Open Complaints']

Policies_date = df.groupby('Effective To Date').sum().sort_values('Number of Policies',ascending=False)['Number of Policies']

Monthly_Premium_date = df.groupby('Effective To Date').sum().sort_values('Monthly Premium Auto',ascending=False)['Monthly Premium Auto']

Total_Claim_Amount_date = df.groupby('Effective To Date').sum().sort_values('Total Claim Amount',ascending=False)['Total Claim Amount']

source.9cf6573a:
IBM-Marketing Analysis & Visualizations

## What is IBM Watson Marketing? > **IBM Watson Marketing provides a portfolio of marketing solutions that allow marketing professionals to design and execute digital marketing campaigns. This cloud-based system is compatible with Mac and PC/Linux operating systems, and also runs on mobile devices. The Watson Marketing system features individual applications to accomplish several different digital marketing tasks. Users can design and execute marketing campaigns via email, web, and social media with Watson Campaign Automation, which also offers lead scoring and lead management. Additionally, users can manage all marketing content and resources with the Watson Content Hub and use Watson Analytics tools to analyze and improve performance with role-based dashboards, journey analytics, and session replay tools. Pricing is based on user counts and the needed functionality of each individual company.** ---------------------
